title: Module 4 Pt 1: Extension for Climate-Smart Agriculture

subtasks: Explain that agricultural extension applies new knowledge from applied research to agricultural practices.
Describe the purpose of extension as transferring new knowledge and facilitating its adoption by the sector.
Mention that extension can focus on any aspect of agriculture, such as climate change adaptation and mitigation.
Explain the importance of two-way communication between researchers and farmers in extension.
Highlight the role of relationships and cooperation in effective extension service delivery.
Discuss the structure of the Cooperative Extension Service in the U.S. involving federal, state, local governments, and land-grant universities.
Emphasize extension's role in addressing complex sustainability challenges in agriculture.

tasks.task: Discuss the necessity of agricultural extension.
subtasks: Highlight the power and potential of agricultural extension.
Explain how extension can advance climate change mitigation and adaptation.

tasks.task: Clarify the concept of agricultural extension.
subtasks: Provide examples of different types of extension (e.g., youth development, economic development, community extension).
Describe the central methodology of extension as transferring knowledge created through applied research.
Emphasize the importance of farmer engagement and education programming in extension.
Discuss the role of extension in facilitating communication between researchers and practitioners.
